instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00239  short on ppbus_g3h
threads.message: 820-00239 touchbar 13 macbook has a short on pp3v3_g3h, I can't find the short, I removed SMC and hall sensor and other capacitor because they were getting hot, but I soldered them back because they were not shorted. I use an external power supply but all resistor and capacitor on pp3v3_g3h line  gets quite hot, board absorbs 5A and voltage of external power supply goes obviously down to 0.9v.  what could it be? Any suggestion?

threads.title: 820-00239  short on ppbus_g3h
threads.message: I cannot tell you what is shorted as it could be anything. Inject voltage and see what heats up. Also why put back stuff when the short has not been solved? There could be many things shorted, could even be inside the board. At 5A something must get pretty toasty.
